data.title: Atom doesn't run after november Windows 10 update...
data.body: Atom was working fine, windows was working fine.. until an automatic update of windows 10 last night. It messed up not only my task bar (which is fixed now by booting in safe mode), but Atom is still a mess.. All I get is a blank window with the path to the file I tried to open. Re-install doesn't fix the problem, neither does running Atom with a previous windows' settings. Did anyone else encounter similar problems or might have an idea on how to get things working properly again?

data.title: Cannot build Atom 1.3.0-beta6 on Ubuntu 15.10 64-bit: ECONNRESET and ELIFECYCLE errors
data.body:
I'm trying to build the latest beta release of Atom (1.3.0-beta6) on my laptop running Ubuntu 15.10 64-bit. I first ran the following inside `~/atom` to update my local copy of the source, as per [the Linux build instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md#instructions):

```
git fetch -p
git checkout $(git describe --tags `git rev-list --tags --max-count=1`)
```

...but I'm getting the following output from `script/build` when run afterwards:

```
christopher@AuroraUnit:~/atom$ script/build
Node: v0.10.25
npm: v1.4.21
Installing build modules...
Installing apm...

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at errnoException (net.js:901:11)
    at TCP.onread (net.js:556:19)
npm ERR! Linux 4.2.0-19-generic
npm ERR! argv "node" "/home/christopher/atom/build/node_modules/.bin/npm" "--userconfig=/home/christopher/atom/build/.npmrc" "--target=0.10.35" "install" "--loglevel" "error"
npm ERR! node v0.10.25
npm ERR! npm  v2.13.3
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE

npm ERR! atom-package-manager@1.4.1 install: `node ./script/download-node.js`
npm ERR! Exit status 8
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the atom-package-manager@1.4.1 install script 'node ./script/download-node.js'.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the atom-package-manager package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node ./script/download-node.js
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls atom-package-manager
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /home/christopher/atom/apm/npm-debug.log
```

The last version of Atom I tried to build was Atom 1.2.0-beta0, and that was successful. Running `script/clean` before `script/build` still does not resolve the issue.

data.title: Show user-made API documentation on mouse hover, like in Eclipse, NetBeans or IntelliJ/PHPStorm
data.body:
[There](https://atom.io/packages/api-docs) [are](https://atom.io/packages/quick-docs) [a lot of](https://atom.io/packages/live-doc-viewer) [Atom](https://atom.io/packages/quickdoc) [packages](https://atom.io/packages/devdocs) (← 5 links in there) which show API documentation in different ways, but none of them show user-made docs (Javadoc/JSDoc/PHPDoc format), only general language API documentation, for example from [DevDocs](http://devdocs.io/).

There are even packages like [jsdoc](https://atom.io/packages/jsdoc) or [docblockr](https://atom.io/packages/docblockr) which help the user by generating the documentation comments, but it seems that there are no packages which can read and display those comments on hover or click and there is no such functionality in Atom itself.

Example of the functionality in Eclipse:
![Eclipse Javadoc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2381553/21856834/97207daa-d823-11e6-916a-a28c850234fc.png)

data.body: Both the stable and the beta release crash silently on Ubuntu 15.10 using both MATE and Xubuntu desktops. There's nothing in the system logs and even launching with `--safe` or `-f -d` or `-l` options make no difference. Any idea what's the problem?

data.title: Block Decorations
data.body:
Implements and closes #9819.

![block-decorations](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/11559474/6c857aea-99b9-11e5-921f-ba83bad27c09.gif)

The above GIF lasts `~ 50s` and showcases the integration of the block decorations API with the existing primitives within Atom (so, bear with it if it takes a bit to load :sweat_smile:). By default, we attach a decoration to a screen row: when the buffer changes or the underlying marker moves, we make sure to move the block decoration as well so that we can correctly calculate the other visual elements positions with respect to such decoration.

A block decoration can be created through the standard API to decorate markers:

``` js
editor.decorateMarker(
  editor.markScreenPosition([screenRow, 0]),
  {type: "block", item: item}
)
```

Decorations will be (re)measured if:
1. They are visible.
2. They are invisible but they were just added.
3. The editor width changes.
4. `TextEditorElement::invalidateBlockDecorationDimensions(blockDecoration)` is called.
5. They intersect with the buffer splicing region.

There could be some edge cases I haven't taken into account, but here's what I think it's missing:
- [x] Implement a non-linear (logarithmic) algorithm to handle screen-to-pixel positions conversion.
- [x] `offsetHeight` doesn't take margins into account.
- [x] Remove `addBlockDecorationForScreenRow`.
- [x] What happens when resizing the editor? Some block decorations above could need to be resized, thus changing all the items' position after them.
- [x] Correctly handle buffer vs. screen rows by invalidating the splicing region.
- [x] Handle custom gutters as well.
- [x] Inspect the `~ 3-4ms` slowdown when adding/removing many block decorations outside the shadow root.
  - This doesn't seem to be related to block decorations having a unique `id` or being teleported inside the shadow DOM because of `<content>`. Instead, it appears that some styles that cross the shadow boundary make style recalculation a bit slower when many block decorations get swapped in and out from screen. 
- [x] Add missing documentation (mark everything as experimental)
- [x] Allow to position block decorations before or after the marked position
- [x] Update documentation
- [ ] Test-drive! :car:
- [x] **Question:** should we implement a version that works without the shadow DOM? Maybe we can defer this to another PR, when the API stabilizes.

data.title: Choosing "Help" -> "Documentation" from menu freezes Atom
data.body: This one is reproducible for me: running Atom 1.2.1 as root (don't ask me why, I know it's wrong) on Ubuntu with LXDE desktop environment. Needs restarting when this happens.

data.title: Stable
Cannot install packages and possibly wrong error reported
data.body:
Log:

```
gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
gyp info using node-gyp@2.0.2
gyp info using node@0.10.40 | win32 | ia32
gyp http GET https://atom.io/download/atom-shell/v0.34.0/node-v0.34.0.tar.gz
gyp WARN install got an error, rolling back install
gyp
```

Looks to me that the GET failed (because, well, of Chinese GFW). I have a proxy but I don't know how to direct Atom through it, or how to inform Atom to use a mirror. Definitely related to #7575.

One solution would be bundle new node version into the installer. But I am not sure where are the other packages hosted. This might mean that all packages are blocked.

On the other hand, the error is reported as `Compiler tools not found` when I have both Python and VS installed.

data.title: Inconsistent file formatting for exceptions on Windows
data.body:
I noticed while running specs that the way that there's absolutely no consistency in how the file is displayed in exceptions (eg the `at file:line:column` display)

Examples:
- `C:\Users\user\Documents\GitHub\atom\spec\text-editor-component-spec.js` - Expected, this seems to be super rare though :frowning: 
- `file:///C:/Users/user/Documents/GitHub/atom/spec/project-spec.coffee` - Acceptable, much more common
- `C:/Users/user/Documents/GitHub/atom/spec/text-editor-component-spec.js` - Technically not correct.  This only seems to appear when the file isn't wrapped in parentheses (so it also doesn't have a function associated with it).  Probably just forgetting to relativize the path.
- `file:\C:\Users\user\Documents\GitHub\atom\spec\config-spec.coffee` - ..._what_?  Seems to be the most common too :worried:.  I'm going to take a quick guess and say that the relativizing of paths is just converting `/` to `\`, leading to `file:\\\C` which is escaped to `file:\C`.
- `/C:/Users/user/Documents/GitHub/atom/src/buffered-process.coffee` - Definitely not correct.  This only occurs in custom logging, for example the config and deserializer validation (`source: /C:/file (line)`).  No idea what's happening here.

In addition, outside of specs, there's also a lot of inconsistency:  most exceptions will thankfully be either of the form `C:\` or `file:///C:/` though.  However, the `/C:/` version is displayed for errors from `init.coffee` (`At /C:/Users/user/.atom/init.coffee:4`).  The actual stacktrace contains the `file:///` version though: `at atom-text-editor.atom.commands.add.custom:trigger-error (file:///C:/Users/user/.atom/init.coffee:17:2)`.

Only the `C:\` and `file:///C:/` versions are properly caught by the Notifications package.

data.title: Update specs for language-javascript changes
data.body:
`let` and `var` are now tokenized as `storage.type.var.js` instead of `storage.modifier.js`.
# TODO:
- [x] Get core specs to pass
- [x] Update language-html (atom/language-html#97)
- [x] Get package specs to pass

Refs atom/language-javascript#277

Closes #8556

data.title: auto-update should be configuable
data.body:
Auto-update should not be enabled by default. When in China the download speed is very slow(the server maybe blocked). Sometimes the menu shows 'launch to install updates' but when I  relaunch Atom it failed to install the updates and the UI gets very weired(I got two atom interfaces and one have a blank screen which does not responds to any click events)
I think we should put auto-updating to a configurable option in `Preferencs`.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'restoreFromSnapshot' of undefined
data.body:
Hello,

I am receiving this error while trying to undo a few changes, but I do not remember doing anything specific.

I was unable to reproduce this issue in a new file, but the error always appears in this file at a particular position in history. I can type a few characters, undo that typing normally, but the next undo will cause this error. I cannot seem to be able to undo to a state before this error.

**Atom Version**: 1.3.0-beta6
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'restoreFromSnapshot' of undefined

data.title: Keybindings shouldn't be case-sensitive
data.body:
## In Atom v1.2.4

If I add this to my `keymap`:

``` coffeescript
'html body atom-workspace.workspace *':
  'cmd-L': 'go-to-line:toggle'
```

and hit Cmd+L, it selects the line (the default behavior).  If I make the L lowercase:

``` coffeescript
'html body atom-workspace.workspace *':
  'cmd-l': 'go-to-line:toggle'
```

It works as expected (using `go-to-line` instead of `select-line`).

Keymaps should be case-insensitive.  Barring that, a warning should be thrown if a keymap contains non-lowercase keys.

Related: #9194

data.title: Lag when typing return on a 3000 line php file, also seems related to the complexity of the code
data.body:
Hi,

I have a file that is almost 3000 lines long and when I press return there is lag. When I press return 2 or more times I get proportionally more lag.
I can't post the test file but you can try this file

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bcit-ci/CodeIgniter/develop/tests/codeigniter/libraries/Form_validation_test.php

and copy paste the code inside it until you get ~3000 or more lines of code. 

I also want t o mention that the lag also seems related to the complexity of the code, or maybe size, as a 3000 line of echo 'echo'; statements doesn't show a noticeable lag.

Thank you

data.title: Mac: Offer to move application to Applications folder
data.body:
![move](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/382183/11536223/6e7783ea-98e5-11e5-9839-791ac3401763.png)

This best practice is discussed here:

data.title: Braces in strings are not ignored when highlighting the corresponding open/close brace
data.body:
Repro:
1. use code

``` js
function x(){
 console.log('        {(         ');
}
```
1. set cursor at "{" or "(" inside the string.

Expected:
no counterpart ("}" resp. ")") is highlighted.

Happens:
Next following "}" resp. ")" outside of the string is shown.

![2015-12-02 17_03_12-untitled - atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/169885/11536139/719aaff2-9917-11e5-919e-386b906096fa.png)
